Class MyRectangle

extends java.awt.Rectangle

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    MyRectangle()
    Constructs a new MyRectangle whose upper left corner is at (0,0) and whose width = 1 and height = 1.
    MyRectangle​(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.lang.String c)
    Constructs a new MyRectangle whose upper left corner is at (x,y) and whose width and height are specified by the arguments of the same name.

    Constructs a new MyRectangle whose upper left corner is at (x,y) and whose width and height are specified by the arguments of the same name.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int area()
    Calculates and returns the area of the rectangle.
    MyRectangle copy()
    Returns a MyRectangle object whose location, dimensions, border and colors are the same as this MyRectangle object.

    Returns the border color of the rectangle if there is one, otherwise returns "none".

    Returns the fill color of the rectangle.

    Returns true if the rectangle has a border.
    int perimeter()
    Calculates and returns the perimeter of the rectangle.
    void rotate​(int degrees)
    Rotate clockwise the rectangle the number of degrees stored in the parameter degrees using the upper left corner (x,y) as an anchor.
    void setBorder​(boolean border)
    Sets the border field to true if the rectangle is supposed to have a border, false if not.
    void setBorderColor​(java.lang.String borderColor)
    Sets the border color to borderColor and sets border to true.
    void setColor​(java.lang.String color)
    Sets the fill color of the rectangle to color.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a String representation of the location, dimensions and colors of this rectangle.

  • Field Details

    • color

      private java.lang.String color
      The rectangle's fill color.

    • borderColor

      private java.lang.String borderColor
      The rectangle's border color.

    • border

      private boolean border
      True if the rectangle has a border.

  • Constructor Details

    • MyRectangle

      public MyRectangle​(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.lang.String c, java.lang.String bc, boolean border)
      Constructs a new MyRectangle whose upper left corner is at (x,y) and whose width and height are specified by the arguments of the same name. Sets the fill color to c and the border color to bc if the rectangle has a border.
      Parameters:
      x - - x coordinate of the upper left corner
      y - - y coordinate of the upper left corner
      width - - width of rectangle
      height - - height of rectangle
      c - - fill color
      bc - - border color
      border - - true if rectangle is surrounded by a border

    • MyRectangle

      public MyRectangle​(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.lang.String c)
      Constructs a new MyRectangle whose upper left corner is at (x,y) and whose width and height are specified by the arguments of the same name. Sets the fill color to c and there is no border.
      Parameters:
      x - - x coordinate of the upper left corner
      y - - y coordinate of the upper left corner
      width - - width of rectangle
      height - - height of rectangle
      c - - fill color

    • MyRectangle

      public MyRectangle()
      Constructs a new MyRectangle whose upper left corner is at (0,0) and whose width = 1 and height = 1. Sets the fill color to black and there is no border.

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public java.lang.String getColor()
      Returns the fill color of the rectangle.
      Returns:
      - fill color

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(java.lang.String color)
      Sets the fill color of the rectangle to color.
      Parameters:
      color - - new fill color.

    • getBorderColor

      public java.lang.String getBorderColor()
      Returns the border color of the rectangle if there is one, otherwise returns "none".
      Returns:
      - border color

    • setBorderColor

      public void setBorderColor​(java.lang.String borderColor)
      Sets the border color to borderColor and sets border to true.
      Parameters:
      borderColor - - new border color.

    • hasBorder

      public boolean hasBorder()
      Returns true if the rectangle has a border.
      Returns:
      - true if the rectangle has a border.

    • setBorder

      public void setBorder​(boolean border)
      Sets the border field to true if the rectangle is supposed to have a border, false if not.
      Parameters:
      border - - true if the rectangle should have a border, false if not.

    • area

      public int area()
      Calculates and returns the area of the rectangle.
      Returns:
      The area of the rectangle.

    • perimeter

      public int perimeter()
      Calculates and returns the perimeter of the rectangle.
      Returns:
      The perimeter of the rectangle.

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(int degrees)
      Rotate clockwise the rectangle the number of degrees stored in the parameter degrees using the upper left corner (x,y) as an anchor. Precondition - degrees will always be 90, 180 or 270. If not, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      degrees - - number of degrees to rotate the rectangle.

    • copy

      public MyRectangle copy()
      Returns a MyRectangle object whose location, dimensions, border and colors are the same as this MyRectangle object.
      Returns:
      A copy of this rectangle.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the location, dimensions and colors of this rectangle. If there is no border, the border color is not printed.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.awt.Rectangle
